top_comment.text:
as an elf this is the best way i can think of supporting you hottests:

don't be too disappointed even though 2pm stopped promoting i think the 
song stays on the charts so if you really do go crazy there is still a 
chance to win but you can't just rely on korean fans to do the streaming or 
other stuff. you have to buy as many albums as you can(if you don't have 
enough money you can donate to a trustworthy fan base who can collect money 
and buy albums and then they can do a giveaway draw or something) you have 
to vote on the charts for example some charts have a global korean and 
japanese section you have to vote on all of them. international fans can't 
stream and buy digitally from some charts but korean hottest are normal 
people too and they have just as much money as you do so you have to do 
donation projects for example a reliable fan base runs the project and some 
korean fans volunteer to stream/buy other things you can collaborate on 
 making accounts to vote with and using them that is  split into two teams 
one makes accounts and one votes(although it may seem a bit unfair that's 
how it has to be if you want to win because at the end of the day even if 
you come out with the best song if the votes are not enough you won't win) 
also the mv views count so you have to watch the mv a lot you should aim 
for a million views every 2-3 days also when the show is live you can send 
an sms to vote (even if you are an international fan) i'm not 100% sure on 
the details for that so its better to ask korean fans. it is a lot of hard 
work but if you are not willing to do it them you can't complain can you? 
also you have to unite and work together if you didn't win you should cheer 
each other up and encourage each other to do better. im sure you can do it 
if you try.
so i think that is all for my rant if you have any questions ask me i will 
try my best to reply. and my dear hottest i know that it is really 
disappointing when newer groups win but you have to stay calm if there is a 
hater just report them don't reply. on a brighter note they might release a 
repackaged version :)﻿

No way the views hasn't hit 10 million already… I strongly believe that 
when youtube had the "error playback" problem when the video was first 
released affected the views a lot… ﻿
top_comment.author: Dark17Moon

comments.text:
Yeah, I think a lot of people were not watching it properly so the views 
got marked as spam. YT has rules when it comes to increasing views. Like 
the video has to be on HD 720 or 1080, 50% volume or higher, you have to 
search the video in the search bar, clear YT history after 10 views, clear 
cookies after 10 views, close window and research video again. That's why 
there's a lot of suggestions to log out of your YT account so it accurately 
counts views better and to watch on Incognito mode if you're on Chrome.
comments.author: Lily Linh

comments.text: +Lily Linh the party version was marked as spam? really?
comments.author: Dark17Moon

comments.text:
Views were divided a bit at the beginning of release since the Party 
version was released shortly after the original, and we were told that the 
Party version was the one that they were gonna start using to count for the 
music shows, but the video got marked as spam. So, the views definitely 
should be higher

 Since my last post was deleted for some reason I'm sure this one will be 
too, but like i said in my last post there are reasons K-Pop videos get 
that high in views while others don't. For GG and BB/GD-Taeyang the YouTube 
Music awards is what has brought them so many views on Good Boy, I got a 
Boy, and etc. For 2NE1 it was the fact that they were on The Bachelorette, 
had their songs played on US Radios, and had their song featured in a Mac 
Book Air US Commercial that has netted them a lot more views. Plus the 
videos you're talking about are a LOT older than this, so it's silly to 
compare this 2PM video to them. If 2PM was put on the YouTube Awards and 
feature in America more they'd have the same kind of views. 11.2 million 
views in 5months is pretty good for a K-Pop group and shows that 2Pm is 
indeed very popular.
